channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2025010244
item.description:
Report E-2025010244

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a two metal totes containing hazardous product, Unisol Liquid Red BK 50. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5-gallon release from two metal totes that impacted 1’x1’ areas on tops and sides of the totes, the wooden trailer floor, and the concrete dock floor. One of the totes had a loose bung cap that was mis-threaded, and the other tote had a loose lid that was easily tightened. The contractor used simple green to clean-up the release and performed slosh tests on the totes. One 55-gallon DM of waste was generated containing impacted rags, floor debris, and PPE. The totes will ship onto the consignee. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024080437
item.description:
Report E-2024080437

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-18T00:47:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-20
  • City: DETROIT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver was delivering sulfuric acid into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the delivery hose and storage tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 1 gallon of sulfuric acid to be released. A portion of the spilled acid sprayed onto the driver causing minor injuries.
